results.title: Robocop 2 (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Irvin Kershner, Jon Davison and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: In the pollution-ridden future, the city of Detroit is crumbling into decay and poverty. The drug-lords have introduced a new drug, Nuke, which is so seductive a majority of the population have become addicted to it. The only solution to the spiralling catastrophe of crime is the superhuman strength of Robocop, the world’s most efficient crime-fighting machine. This fast- paced, action-crammed sequel features superb special effects. Stars Peter Weller and Nancy Allen.

results.title: Rolling Stone: 20 Years of Rock N' Roll
results.brief_description: This video includes interviews with: Mick Jagger, George Harrison, Jerry Garcia, Sting, David Bowie, Tina Turner, Joni Mitchell, Lou Reed, George Clinton, Robbie Robertson, Aretha Franklin, David Byrne, Smokey Robinson, and Dennis Hopper. It also features performances by: The Beatles, Jefferson Airplane, Otis Redding, The Police, Aretha Franklin, The Who, Bob Dylan, The Band, The Rolling Stones, The Doors, Led Zeppelin, T Rex, David Bowie, Bruce Springsteen, Jackson Browne, and The Eagles.

results.title: Roller skate safely
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of protective wear in roller skating and also stresses the importance of routine safety and maintenance checks to skates. A variety of skates are shown, with suggestions for purchase or rental. Shows the important basic techniques of how to stop and how to fall.

results.title: Rock 'n' roll and the 1950's. Vols 1-4
results.brief_description: Rock ‘n’ roll and the 1950’s presents in four volumes a collection of rare and historical footage without commentary that captures the energy and values of the 1950s that embodied the Rock & Roll culture. Featured is live performance clips along with movie trailers, advertisements and other footage that describe the mood of the day and it’s cultural values. Included are televised performances of: Bill Haley and The Comets, Fats Domino, The Platters, Gene Vincent, the Everly Brothers, Bobby Darin, Charlie Grace, Jerry Lee Lewis, Buddy Holly, the Big Bopper, Ritchie Valens and of course Elvis Presley.

results.title: Robotech: the Macross saga. 6. Final conflict
results.creator_credit: Carl Macek, Harmony Gold and Tatsunoko Production Co
results.brief_description: At the end of the twentieth century evidence of an advanced alien civilization emerges when an enormous spaceship crashes on earth. The United Earth government is formed to combat impending invasion and to research the advanced and dangerous alien technologies. In this American futuristic anime television series Rick, Ben, Max, and Lisa are four earthlings doing battle in cyber-space, whilst dealing with their complex romantic lives. This disc, entitled “Final conflict”, contains six episodes from the “Macross Saga”. “Khyron’s revenge”: Rick patrols the skies of earth’s new civilisation on a constant vigil against alien attack. Khyron plans a fresh attack. “Broken heart”: Khyron succeeds in capturing Minmay and Kyle, using them as a prop to gain control of the SDF-1. “A Rainy night”: Claudia gives Lisa advice, recalling her doomed romance with an exceptional fighter pilot. “Private time”: the Zentraedi forces gather in a fresh assault. Rick tries to sort out his emotions for Lisa and Minmay. “Season’s greetings”: Khron plans a surprise Christmas present for the citizens of Macross city. “To the stars”: Khyron plans his ultimate revenge, threatening the future of all earth. Lisa faces a difficult choice.

results.title: Robotech: the Macross saga. 5. War and peace
results.creator_credit: Carl Macek, Harmony Gold and Tatsunoko Production Co
results.brief_description: At the end of the twentieth century evidence of an advanced alien civilization emerges when an enormous spaceship crashes on earth. The United Earth government is formed to combat impending invasion and to research the advanced and dangerous alien technologies. In this American futuristic anime television series Rick, Ben, Max, and Lisa are four earthlings doing battle in cyber-space, whilst dealing with their complex romantic lives. This disc, entitled “War and peace”, contains six episodes from the “Macross Saga”. “Wedding bells”: Max’s budding romance takes a dramatic turn as outside forces try to stymie his marriage to a Micronian. “The Messenger”: an uneasy truce is drawn as the Zentraedi sends a convoy to discuss peace plans. “Force of arms”: the earth is surrounded by an armada of enemy vessels. “Reconstruction blues”: the earth faces the mammoth task of rebuilding, as the SDF-1 crew assess the damage. “Robotech masters”: war begins to creep back into the lives of those who have fought hard for peace. “Viva Miriya”: several unlikely forces join an alliance for peace.

results.title: Robotech: the Macross saga. 4. Battlefront
results.creator_credit: Carl Macek, Harmony Gold and Tatsunoko Production Co
results.brief_description: At the end of the twentieth century evidence of an advanced alien civilization emerges when an enormous spaceship crashes on earth. The United Earth government is formed to combat impending invasion and to research the advanced and dangerous alien technologies. In this American futuristic anime television series Rick, Ben, Max, and Lisa are four earthlings doing battle in cyber-space, whilst dealing with their complex romantic lives. This disc, entitled “Battlefront”, contains six episodes from the “Macross Saga”. “Bursting point”: Gloval sets about relocating the refugees stranded on SDF-1, but experiences conflicting loyalties when the future of the earth is threatened. “Paradise lost”: the evil Zentraedi monitors the movements of the SDF-1; the refugees try to make the most of their new surrounds. “A New dawn”: Minmay prepares for the launch of her first motion picture. Rick and Lisa try to resolve their feelings. “Battle hymn”: the Zentraedi campaign to annihilate SDF-1 escalates out of all proportion. “Reckless”: the stage is set for an almighty showdown between earth’s displaced warriors and the relentless Zentraedi. “Showdown”: Lisa makes a rash decision to return to earth in the hope of ending the enduring war.

results.title: Robinson in space
results.creator_credit: Patrick Keiller, Keith Griffiths, BBC Film Unit, British Film Institute and Koninck
results.brief_description: A companion piece to Keiller’s ‘London’ (1994), this film essay also revolves around the unseen fictional characters of Robinson and his nameless companion (a former lover and the film’s narrator). It begins with the narrator’s train journey from London to Reading where Robinson has asked him to join a project he has been commissioned to research on ‘the problem of England’. The space of the title is the sprawl of England that Robinson and his companion traverse on a series of journeys. They visit industrial estates, ports and heritage sites examining English culture, its absences and decline, and the industrial economy. At the core of the film is the monologue where Robinson’s digressions and insights are juxtaposed over quotidian images of contemporary Britain. His explorations lead him to the realisation that the appearance of poverty and dilapidation that characterises the UK is not the result of economic decline but of the exercise of political power and deregulation that has unravelled the social fabric of the country. The narration deftly combines historical, literary, cultural, societal and political commentary with wry, whimsical asides that hint at Robinson’s sexual predilections. Narrated by Paul Scofield.

results.title: Robinson Crusoe
results.creator_credit: Leif Gram, Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description: Scottish sailor, Alexander Selkirk is believed to be the inspiration behind Daniel Defoe’s famous novel. Intrigued by Selkirk’s tale of being marooned in 1704 on a Pacific island for four and a half years, Defoe called his imaginative account, ‘The Life and strange surprising adventures of Robinson Crusoe’. This adventure story is brought to life through animation that will appeal to children and adults alike.

results.title: Roar: Melbourne expressionism in the 1980s
results.creator_credit: Peter Wiseman, Traudi Allen and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Formed in 1982, Roar Studios and the Roar group became synonymous with expressionism, abstract art and the emergence of a new group of talented young Australian artists that helped alter the future course of the teaching and exhibition of art in Australia. This was achieved through the breakdown of the stifling mores of the Australian art world of the time. Through interviews with artists from the original Roar group at a reunion exhibition at Roar 2 in the 1990s, critical discussion of the social circumstances and firm philosophies of the group as well as their key works, this program is an insightful study of one of the first artist run galleries and studios in Melbourne. It explores the experiences, international and local interests, and the diversity of artistic styles but shared influences of the artists who made it happen. It also discusses the significant impact of Roar on the facilitation of exhibitions for women and ethnic artists and on the emergence of an independent Australian art. The Roar artists profiled and interviewed include David Larwill, Pasquale Giardino, Stephen McCarthy, Jill Noble, Tony Mighell, Sarah Faulkner, Mark Howson, Peter Ferguson and Trevor Hoppen. The 26 minute documentary is followed by 20 minutes of extended viewing of stills of key artworks.
